howiwork.title: How I Work
howiwork.description: As a student currently enrolled in a UI/UX design course, I am actively learning foundational principles of user interface design, usability, and the user-centered design process. My workflow is evolving as I gain hands-on experience through coursework, projects, and research-based design practices.

sections.heading: My (Developing) Design Workflow
steps: Research & Requirements Gathering – Understand user needs through interviews, surveys, or competitive analysis.
Sketching & Wireframing – Use tools like Figma to outline basic layouts and interactions.
Prototyping – Create interactive prototypes that simulate user flow and behaviors.
Feedback & Iteration – Conduct usability testing with peers and iterate on design based on findings.
Final UI Design – Apply visual styling, typography, and branding for a polished product.
Handoff or Implementation – Prepare assets and design specs for development.

sections.heading: Course I'm Taking
sections.courseTitle: User Interface Design (SEG3125) – University of Ottawa
sections.courseDescription: Includes topics like wireframing, usability heuristics, and responsive UI design.

howiwork.note: This section will be updated throughout the semester as I apply new concepts and develop a more refined design process.
